intro: Randia guerrerensis, commonly known as Guerrerense randia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded understory environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
